text: I call it a very fine country -- the hills are steep , the woods seem full of fine timber , and the valley looks comfortable and snug -- with rich meadows and several neat farm houses scattered here and there .

text: It exactly answers my idea of a fine country , because it unites beauty with utility -- and I dare say it is a picturesque one too , because you admire it ; I can easily believe it to be full of rocks and promontories , grey moss and brush wood , but these are all lost on me .

text: Edward remained a week at the cottage ; he was earnestly pressed by Mrs. Dashwood to stay longer ; but , as if he were bent only on self - mortification , he seemed resolved to be gone when his enjoyment among his friends was at the height .

text: His spirits , during the last two or three days , though still very unequal , were greatly improved -- he grew more and more partial to the house and environs -- never spoke of going away without a sigh -- declared his time to be wholly disengaged -- even doubted to what place he should go when he left them -- but still , go he must .
text_tokenized: His spirits , during the last two or three days , though still very unequal , were greatly improved -- he grew more and more partial to the house and environs -- never spoke of going away without a sigh -- declared his time to be wholly disengaged -- even doubted to what place he should go when he left them -- but still , go he must .

text: Never had any week passed so quickly -- he could hardly believe it to be gone .
text_tokenized: Never had any week passed so quickly -- he could hardly believe it to be gone .

text: He said so repeatedly ; other things he said too , which marked the turn of his feelings and gave the lie to his actions .
text_tokenized: He said so repeatedly ; other things he said too , which marked the turn of his feelings and gave the lie to his actions .

text: He had no pleasure at Norland ; he detested being in town ; but either to Norland or London , he must go .
text_tokenized: He had no pleasure at Norland ; he detested being in town ; but either to Norland or London , he must go .

text: He valued their kindness beyond any thing , and his greatest happiness was in being with them . Yet , he must leave them at the end of a week , in spite of their wishes and his own , and without any restraint on his time . Elinor placed all that was astonishing in this way of acting to his mother 's account ; and it was happy for her that he had a mother whose character was so imperfectly known to her , as to be the general excuse for every thing strange on the part of her son . Disappointed , however , and vexed as she was , and sometimes displeased with his uncertain behaviour to herself , she was very well disposed on the whole to regard his actions with all the candid allowances and generous qualifications , which had been rather more painfully extorted from her , for Willoughby 's service , by her mother . His want of spirits , of openness , and of consistency , were most usually attributed to his want of independence , and his better knowledge of Mrs. Ferrars 's disposition and designs . The shortness of his visit , the steadiness of his purpose in leaving them , originated in the same fettered inclination , the same inevitable necessity of temporizing with his mother . The old well - established grievance of duty against will , parent against child , was the cause of all .

text: She would have been glad to know when these difficulties were to cease , this opposition was to yield,--when Mrs. Ferrars would be reformed , and her son be at liberty to be happy .

text: But from such vain wishes she was forced to turn for comfort to the renewal of her confidence in Edward 's affection , to the remembrance of every mark of regard in look or word which fell from him while at Barton , and above all to that flattering proof of it which he constantly wore round his finger . " I think , Edward , " said Mrs. Dashwood , as they were at breakfast the last morning , " you would be a happier man if you had any profession to engage your time and give an interest to your plans and actions .

" I think , Edward , " said Mrs. Dashwood , as they were at breakfast the last morning , " you would be a happier man if you had any profession to engage your time and give an interest to your plans and actions .

text: Some inconvenience to your friends , indeed , might result from it -- you would not be able to give them so much of your time .
text_tokenized: Some inconvenience to your friends , indeed , might result from it -- you would not be able to give them so much of your time .

text: But ( with a smile ) you would be materially benefited in one particular at least -- you would know where to go when you left them .
text_tokenized: But ( with a smile ) you would be materially benefited in one particular at least -- you would know where to go when you left them .

text: " " I do assure you , " he replied , " that I have long thought on this point , as you think now .

text: It has been , and is , and probably will always be a heavy misfortune to me , that I have had no necessary business to engage me , no profession to give me employment , or afford me any thing like independence .
text_tokenized: It has been , and is , and probably will always be a heavy misfortune to me , that I have had no necessary business to engage me , no profession to give me employment , or afford me any thing like independence .

text: But unfortunately my own nicety , and the nicety of my friends , have made me what I am , an idle , helpless being .

text: The law was allowed to be genteel enough ; many young men , who had chambers in the Temple , made a very good appearance in the first circles , and drove about town in very knowing gigs .
text_tokenized: The law was allowed to be genteel enough ; many young men , who had chambers in the Temple , made a very good appearance in the first circles , and drove about town in very knowing gigs .

text: But I had no inclination for the law , even in this less abstruse study of it , which my family approved .
text_tokenized: But I had no inclination for the law , even in this less abstruse study of it , which my family approved .

text: As for the navy , it had fashion on its side , but I was too old when the subject was first started to enter it -- and , at length , as there was no necessity for my having any profession at all , as I might be as dashing and expensive without a red coat on my back as with one , idleness was pronounced on the whole to be most advantageous and honourable , and a young man of eighteen is not in general so earnestly bent on being busy as to resist the solicitations of his friends to do nothing .
text_tokenized: As for the navy , it had fashion on its side , but I was too old when the subject was first started to enter it -- and , at length , as there was no necessity for my having any profession at all , as I might be as dashing and expensive without a red coat on my back as with one , idleness was pronounced on the whole to be most advantageous and honourable , and a young man of eighteen is not in general so earnestly bent on being busy as to resist the solicitations of his friends to do nothing .

text: I was therefore entered at Oxford and have been properly idle ever since .
text_tokenized: I was therefore entered at Oxford and have been properly idle ever since .

text: " The consequence of which , I suppose , will be , " said Mrs. Dashwood , " since leisure has not promoted your own happiness , that your sons will be brought up to as many pursuits , employments , professions , and trades as Columella 's .

text: " " They will be brought up , " said he , in a serious accent , " to be as unlike myself as is possible . In feeling , in action , in condition , in every thing .
text_tokenized: " " They will be brought up , " said he , in a serious accent , " to be as unlike myself as is possible . In feeling , in action , in condition , in every thing .

text: " Come , come ; this is all an effusion of immediate want of spirits , Edward .
text_tokenized: " Come , come ; this is all an effusion of immediate want of spirits , Edward .

text: You are in a melancholy humour , and fancy that any one unlike yourself must be happy .
text_tokenized: You are in a melancholy humour , and fancy that any one unlike yourself must be happy .

text: But remember that the pain of parting from friends will be felt by every body at times , whatever be their education or state .
text_tokenized: But remember that the pain of parting from friends will be felt by every body at times , whatever be their education or state .

text: Know your own happiness . You want nothing but patience -- or give it a more fascinating name , call it hope .

text: Your mother will secure to you , in time , that independence you are so anxious for ; it is her duty , and it will , it must ere long become her happiness to prevent your whole youth from being wasted in discontent .
text_tokenized: Your mother will secure to you , in time , that independence you are so anxious for ; it is her duty , and it will , it must ere long become her happiness to prevent your whole youth from being wasted in discontent .

text_tokenized: How much may not a few months do ?

text: " " I think , " replied Edward , " that I may defy many months to produce any good to me . " This desponding turn of mind , though it could not be communicated to Mrs. Dashwood , gave additional pain to them all in the parting , which shortly took place , and left an uncomfortable impression on Elinor 's feelings especially , which required some trouble and time to subdue . But as it was her determination to subdue it , and to prevent herself from appearing to suffer more than what all her family suffered on his going away , she did not adopt the method so judiciously employed by Marianne , on a similar occasion , to augment and fix her sorrow , by seeking silence , solitude and idleness .

text: Their means were as different as their objects , and equally suited to the advancement of each .
text_tokenized: Their means were as different as their objects , and equally suited to the advancement of each .

text: Elinor sat down to her drawing - table as soon as he was out of the house , busily employed herself the whole day , neither sought nor avoided the mention of his name , appeared to interest herself almost as much as ever in the general concerns of the family , and if , by this conduct , she did not lessen her own grief , it was at least prevented from unnecessary increase , and her mother and sisters were spared much solicitude on her account .
text_tokenized: Elinor sat down to her drawing - table as soon as he was out of the house , busily employed herself the whole day , neither sought nor avoided the mention of his name , appeared to interest herself almost as much as ever in the general concerns of the family , and if , by this conduct , she did not lessen her own grief , it was at least prevented from unnecessary increase , and her mother and sisters were spared much solicitude on her account .

text: Such behaviour as this , so exactly the reverse of her own , appeared no more meritorious to Marianne , than her own had seemed faulty to her . The business of self - command she settled very easily;--with strong affections it was impossible , with calm ones it could have no merit . That her sister 's affections WERE calm , she dared not deny , though she blushed to acknowledge it ; and of the strength of her own , she gave a very striking proof , by still loving and respecting that sister , in spite of this mortifying conviction .
text_tokenized: Such behaviour as this , so exactly the reverse of her own , appeared no more meritorious to Marianne , than her own had seemed faulty to her . The business of self - command she settled very easily;--with strong affections it was impossible , with calm ones it could have no merit . That her sister 's affections WERE calm , she dared not deny , though she blushed to acknowledge it ; and of the strength of her own , she gave a very striking proof , by still loving and respecting that sister , in spite of this mortifying conviction .

text: Without shutting herself up from her family , or leaving the house in determined solitude to avoid them , or lying awake the whole night to indulge meditation , Elinor found every day afforded her leisure enough to think of Edward , and of Edward 's behaviour , in every possible variety which the different state of her spirits at different times could produce,--with tenderness , pity , approbation , censure , and doubt . There were moments in abundance , when , if not by the absence of her mother and sisters , at least by the nature of their employments , conversation was forbidden among them , and every effect of solitude was produced .
text_tokenized: Without shutting herself up from her family , or leaving the house in determined solitude to avoid them , or lying awake the whole night to indulge meditation , Elinor found every day afforded her leisure enough to think of Edward , and of Edward 's behaviour , in every possible variety which the different state of her spirits at different times could produce,--with tenderness , pity , approbation , censure , and doubt . There were moments in abundance , when , if not by the absence of her mother and sisters , at least by the nature of their employments , conversation was forbidden among them , and every effect of solitude was produced .

text: Her mind was inevitably at liberty ; her thoughts could not be chained elsewhere ; and the past and the future , on a subject so interesting , must be before her , must force her attention , and engross her memory , her reflection , and her fancy .
text_tokenized: Her mind was inevitably at liberty ; her thoughts could not be chained elsewhere ; and the past and the future , on a subject so interesting , must be before her , must force her attention , and engross her memory , her reflection , and her fancy .

text: From a reverie of this kind , as she sat at her drawing - table
text_tokenized: From a reverie of this kind , as she sat at her drawing - table

text: , she was roused one morning , soon after Edward 's leaving them , by the arrival of company .
text_tokenized: , she was roused one morning , soon after Edward 's leaving them , by the arrival of company .

text: She happened to be quite alone .
text_tokenized: She happened to be quite alone .

text: The closing of the little gate , at the entrance of the green court in front of the house , drew her eyes to the window , and she saw a large party walking up to the door .
text_tokenized: The closing of the little gate , at the entrance of the green court in front of the house , drew her eyes to the window , and she saw a large party walking up to the door .

text: Amongst them were Sir John and Lady Middleton and Mrs. Jennings ,
text_tokenized: Amongst them were Sir John and Lady Middleton and Mrs. Jennings ,

text: but there were two others , a gentleman and lady , who were quite unknown to her . She was sitting near the window , and as soon as Sir John perceived her , he left the rest of the party to the ceremony of knocking at the door , and stepping across the turf , obliged her to open the casement to speak to him , though the space was so short between the door and the window , as to make it hardly possible to speak at one without being heard at the other . " Well , " said he , " we have brought you some strangers .

" Well , " said he , " we have brought you some strangers .

text: It is only the Palmers .
text_tokenized: It is only the Palmers .

text: Charlotte is very pretty , I can tell you .
text_tokenized: Charlotte is very pretty , I can tell you .

text: You may see her if you look this way . " As Elinor was certain of seeing her in a couple of minutes , without taking that liberty , she begged to be excused .
text_tokenized: You may see her if you look this way . " As Elinor was certain of seeing her in a couple of minutes , without taking that liberty , she begged to be excused .

text: " Where is Marianne ?
text_tokenized: " Where is Marianne ?

text: Has she run away because we are come ?
text_tokenized: Has she run away because we are come ?

text: I see her instrument is open . " " She is walking , I believe . "
text_tokenized: I see her instrument is open . " " She is walking , I believe . "

text: They were now joined by Mrs. Jennings , who had not patience enough to wait till the door was opened before she told HER story .
text_tokenized: They were now joined by Mrs. Jennings , who had not patience enough to wait till the door was opened before she told HER story .

text: She came hallooing to the window , " How do you do , my dear ?
text_tokenized: She came hallooing to the window , " How do you do , my dear ?

text: How does Mrs. Dashwood do ? And where are your sisters ? What !
text_tokenized: How does Mrs. Dashwood do ? And where are your sisters ? What !

text: all alone !
text_tokenized: all alone !

text: you will be glad of a little company to sit with you .
text_tokenized: you will be glad of a little company to sit with you .

text: I have brought my other son and daughter to see you .
text_tokenized: I have brought my other son and daughter to see you .

text: Only think of their coming so suddenly !
text_tokenized: Only think of their coming so suddenly !

text: I thought I heard a carriage last night , while we were drinking our tea , but it never entered my head that it could be them .
text_tokenized: I thought I heard a carriage last night , while we were drinking our tea , but it never entered my head that it could be them .

text: I thought of nothing but whether it might not be Colonel Brandon come back again ; so I said to Sir John , I do think I hear a carriage ; perhaps it is Colonel Brandon come back again"-- Elinor was obliged to turn from her , in the middle of her story , to receive the rest of the party ; Lady Middleton introduced the two strangers ; Mrs. Dashwood and Margaret came down stairs at the same time , and they all sat down to look at one another , while Mrs. Jennings continued her story as she walked through the passage into the parlour , attended by Sir John .

text: Mrs. Palmer was several years younger than Lady Middleton , and totally unlike her in every respect .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Palmer was several years younger than Lady Middleton , and totally unlike her in every respect .

text: She was short and plump , had a very pretty face , and the finest expression of good humour in it that could possibly be . Her manners were by no means so elegant as her sister 's , but they were much more prepossessing .
text_tokenized: She was short and plump , had a very pretty face , and the finest expression of good humour in it that could possibly be . Her manners were by no means so elegant as her sister 's , but they were much more prepossessing .

text: She came in with a smile , smiled all the time of her visit , except when she laughed , and smiled when she went away . Her husband was a grave looking young man of five or six and twenty , with an air of more fashion and sense than his wife , but of less willingness to please or be pleased .
text_tokenized: She came in with a smile , smiled all the time of her visit , except when she laughed , and smiled when she went away . Her husband was a grave looking young man of five or six and twenty , with an air of more fashion and sense than his wife , but of less willingness to please or be pleased .

text: He entered the room with a look of self - consequence , slightly bowed to the ladies , without speaking a word , and , after briefly surveying them and their apartments , took up a newspaper from the table , and continued to read it as long as he staid .
text_tokenized: He entered the room with a look of self - consequence , slightly bowed to the ladies , without speaking a word , and , after briefly surveying them and their apartments , took up a newspaper from the table , and continued to read it as long as he staid .

text: Mrs. Palmer , on the contrary , who was strongly endowed by nature with a turn for being uniformly civil and happy , was hardly seated before her admiration of the parlour and every thing in it burst forth .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Palmer , on the contrary , who was strongly endowed by nature with a turn for being uniformly civil and happy , was hardly seated before her admiration of the parlour and every thing in it burst forth .

text: " Well !
text_tokenized: " Well !

text: what a delightful room this is !
text_tokenized: what a delightful room this is !

text: I never saw anything so charming !
text_tokenized: I never saw anything so charming !

text: Only think , Mamma , how it is improved since I was here last !
text_tokenized: Only think , Mamma , how it is improved since I was here last !

text: I always thought it such a sweet place , ma'am !
text_tokenized: I always thought it such a sweet place , ma'am !

text: ( turning to Mrs. Dashwood )
text_tokenized: ( turning to Mrs. Dashwood )

text: but you have made it so charming ! Only look , sister , how delightful every thing is !

text: How I should like such a house for myself !
text_tokenized: How I should like such a house for myself !

text: Should not you , Mr. Palmer ?
text_tokenized: Should not you , Mr. Palmer ?

text: " Mr. Palmer made her no answer , and did not even raise his eyes from the newspaper .
text_tokenized: " Mr. Palmer made her no answer , and did not even raise his eyes from the newspaper .

text: " Mr. Palmer does not hear me , " said she , laughing ; " he never does sometimes .
text_tokenized: " Mr. Palmer does not hear me , " said she , laughing ; " he never does sometimes .

text: It is so ridiculous ! "
text_tokenized: It is so ridiculous ! "

text: This was quite a new idea to Mrs. Dashwood ; she had never been used to find wit in the inattention of any one , and could not help looking with surprise at them both .

text: Mrs. Jennings , in the meantime , talked on as loud as she could , and continued her account of their surprise , the evening before , on seeing their friends , without ceasing till every thing was told . Mrs. Palmer laughed heartily at the recollection of their astonishment , and every body agreed , two or three times over , that it had been quite an agreeable surprise .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Jennings , in the meantime , talked on as loud as she could , and continued her account of their surprise , the evening before , on seeing their friends , without ceasing till every thing was told . text: " You may believe how glad we all were to see them , " added Mrs. Jennings , leaning forward towards Elinor , and speaking in a low voice as if she meant to be heard by no one else , though they were seated on different sides of the room ; " but , however , I ca n't help wishing they had not travelled quite so fast , nor made such a long journey of it , for they came all round by London upon account of some business , for you know ( nodding significantly and pointing to her daughter ) it was wrong in her situation .
text_tokenized: " You may believe how glad we all were to see them , " added Mrs. Jennings , leaning forward towards Elinor , and speaking in a low voice as if she meant to be heard by no one else , though they were seated on different sides of the room ; " but , however , I ca n't help wishing they had not travelled quite so fast , nor made such a long journey of it , for they came all round by London upon account of some business , for you know ( nodding significantly and pointing to her daughter ) it was wrong in her situation .

text: I wanted her to stay at home and rest this morning , but she would come with us ; she longed so much to see you all ! "
text_tokenized: I wanted her to stay at home and rest this morning , but she would come with us ; she longed so much to see you all ! "

text: Mrs. Palmer laughed , and said it would not do her any harm . " She expects to be confined in February , " continued Mrs. Jennings . Lady Middleton could no longer endure such a conversation , and therefore exerted herself to ask Mr. Palmer if there was any news in the paper . " No , none at all , " he replied , and read on .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Palmer laughed , and said it would not do her any harm . " She expects to be confined in February , " continued Mrs. Jennings . Lady Middleton could no longer endure such a conversation , and therefore exerted herself to ask Mr. Palmer if there was any news in the paper . " No , none at all , " he replied , and read on .

text: " Here comes Marianne , " cried Sir John .
text_tokenized: " Here comes Marianne , " cried Sir John .

text: " Now , Palmer , you shall see a monstrous pretty girl . "
text_tokenized: " Now , Palmer , you shall see a monstrous pretty girl . "

text: He immediately went into the passage , opened the front door , and ushered her in himself . Mrs. Jennings asked her , as soon as she appeared , if she had not been to Allenham ; and Mrs. Palmer laughed so heartily at the question , as to show she understood it .

text: Mr. Palmer looked up on her entering the room , stared at her some minutes , and then returned to his newspaper . Mrs. Palmer 's eye was now caught by the drawings which hung round the room . She got up to examine them .

text: When Lady Middleton rose to go away , Mr. Palmer rose also , laid down the newspaper , stretched himself and looked at them all around .
text_tokenized: When Lady Middleton rose to go away , Mr. Palmer rose also , laid down the newspaper , stretched himself and looked at them all around .

text: " My love , have you been asleep ? " said his wife , laughing .
text_tokenized: " My love , have you been asleep ? " said his wife , laughing .

text: He made her no answer ; and only observed , after again examining the room , that it was very low pitched , and that the ceiling was crooked . He then made his bow , and departed with the rest .
text_tokenized: He made her no answer ; and only observed , after again examining the room , that it was very low pitched , and that the ceiling was crooked . He then made his bow , and departed with the rest .

text: Sir John had been very urgent with them all to spend the next day at the park .
text_tokenized: Sir John had been very urgent with them all to spend the next day at the park .

text: Mrs. Dashwood , who did not chuse to dine with them oftener than they dined at the cottage , absolutely refused on her own account ; her daughters might do as they pleased .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Dashwood , who did not chuse to dine with them oftener than they dined at the cottage , absolutely refused on her own account ; her daughters might do as they pleased .

text: But they had no curiosity to see how Mr. and Mrs. Palmer ate their dinner , and no expectation of pleasure from them in any other way . They attempted , therefore , likewise , to excuse themselves ; the weather was uncertain , and not likely to be good .
text_tokenized: But they had no curiosity to see how Mr. and Mrs. Palmer ate their dinner , and no expectation of pleasure from them in any other way . They attempted , therefore , likewise , to excuse themselves ; the weather was uncertain , and not likely to be good .

text: But Sir John would not be satisfied -- the carriage should be sent for them and they must come .
text_tokenized: But Sir John would not be satisfied -- the carriage should be sent for them and they must come .

text: Lady Middleton too , though she did not press their mother , pressed them .
text_tokenized: Lady Middleton too , though she did not press their mother , pressed them .

text: Mrs. Jennings and Mrs. Palmer joined their entreaties , all seemed equally anxious to avoid a family party ; and the young ladies were obliged to yield .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Jennings and Mrs. Palmer joined their entreaties , all seemed equally anxious to avoid a family party ; and the young ladies were obliged to yield .

text: " Why should they ask us ? " said Marianne , as soon as they were gone . " The rent of this cottage is said to be low ; but we have it on very hard terms , if we are to dine at the park whenever any one is staying either with them , or with us . "
text_tokenized: " Why should they ask us ? " said Marianne , as soon as they were gone . " The rent of this cottage is said to be low ; but we have it on very hard terms , if we are to dine at the park whenever any one is staying either with them , or with us . "

text: " They mean no less to be civil and kind to us now , " said Elinor , " by these frequent invitations , than by those which we received from them a few weeks ago .
text_tokenized: " They mean no less to be civil and kind to us now , " said Elinor , " by these frequent invitations , than by those which we received from them a few weeks ago .

text: The alteration is not in them , if their parties are grown tedious and dull . We must look for the change elsewhere . "
text_tokenized: The alteration is not in them , if their parties are grown tedious and dull . We must look for the change elsewhere . "
